meanings.definition: To act as an escort or companion to someone, especially a woman.
meanings.sent1: He enjoys esquiring his grandmother to the park every Sunday.
meanings.sent2: She asked him to esquire her to the party.
meanings.sent3: The cat insisted on esquiring the dog around the house.
meanings.sent4: The sun esquired the moon across the sky as they danced in the night.
meanings.sent5: The knight esquired the princess through the enchanted forest.

meanings.definition: The act of accompanying or escorting someone, typically a woman.
meanings.sent1: Her esquiring of the elderly lady to the store was heartwarming.
meanings.sent2: The esquiring of the debutante to the ball was a grand affair.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's esquiring of the fish to its nest was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The river's esquiring of the boats downstream was a gentle journey.
meanings.sent5: The cloud's esquiring of the raindrops to the ground was a peaceful descent.
